Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] who can help me:Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0"
 java.lang.NoSuchMethodErr
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=7r8xoOzCWXTXzjoCQ8WzUiZVB33vKbGx1BR_BH1WnemS
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Heritrix needs to make a number of small patches to the Apache 
HttpClient library we use. For example, we insert code that lets us 
record the HTTP request and response bye streams exactly, and replace 
the default in-memory Cookie map with a disk-backed map that can grow 
much larger without creating memory problems.

This error suggests our added method for using the alternate Cookie 
structure isn't present. This might happen if your Java classpath is 
different than our defaults (as set by our launch scripts), which puts 
our changed HttpClient classes earlier than the standard ones (so they 
take their place).

Please check your method of launching Heritrix to make sure the Heritrix 
JAR (such as 'heritrix-1.14.3.jar' in Heritrix 1.14.3) is before the 
'commons-httpclient-3.1.jar' JAR on the effective classpath.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
